lead_paragraph: Since 2010, at least 15 companies — like Simon Property Group, the shopping mall giant, and Darden Restaurants, the owner of the Olive Garden chain — have taken advantage of a federal tax loophole allowing them to do a tax-free spin off of real estate into new corporate entities. Congress on Friday moved to shut that maneuver down.

headline.main: A Profitable Benefit — Left Open a Bit Longer
